metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7033 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SchedMD Slurm before 17.02.10 and 17.11.x before 17.11.5 allows SQL Injection attacks against SlurmDBD. It was discovered that an SQL injection vulnerability exists in the Slurm. A local attacker could use this to gain elevated privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libpmi0 - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libslurm-perl - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libslurm29 - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libslurmdb-perl - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
libslurmdb29 - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-client - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-client-emulator - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-llnl - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-llnl-slurmdbd - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-wlm - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-wlm-emulator - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurm-wlm-torque - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurmctld - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurmd - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
slurmdbd - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
sview - 15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.08.7-1ubuntu0.1~esm3').
